Method Detail

addOrRetrieveExistingFileSystemElement

public static Element addOrRetrieveExistingFileSystemElement(Document jsdl,
                                                             String fileSystemName,
                                                             String fileSystemRoot)
Adds a FileSystem element to the specified jsdl document. If a filesystem with that name already exists, the new root url is that and it is returned.

Parameters:
jsdl - the jsdl document
fileSystemName - the name of the (possibly new) filesystem
fileSystemRoot - the root url for the filesystem
Returns:
the filesystem element

extractTargetFromStageInElement

public static String extractTargetFromStageInElement(Element stageIn)
Extracts the target filesystem url from a given StageIn element.

Parameters:
stageIn - a DataStaging element from a jsdl file
Returns:
the url of the file to stage in

getAbsoluteWorkingDirectoryUrl

public static String getAbsoluteWorkingDirectoryUrl(Document jsdl)
Returns an absolute url to the working directory of this job.

Parameters:
jsdl - the jsdl document
Returns:
the absolute url

getApplicationName

public static String getApplicationName(Document jsdl)
Parses the jsdl document and returns the value of the ApplicationName element. Be aware that this is not the name or path of the executable.

Parameters:
jsdl - the jsdl document
Returns:
the name of the applications

getApplicationVersion

public static String getApplicationVersion(Document jsdl)
Returns the version of the application for this job.

Parameters:
jsdl - the jsdl document
Returns:
the version

getArcsJobType

public static String getArcsJobType(Document jsdl)
Whether this is a forced-single or forced-mpi job. This is an ARCS-extension to jsdl and is used for usecases where users want to run 1 cpu mpi jobs or multiple cpu single jobs.

Parameters:
jsdl - the jsdl document
Returns:
the job type (single/mpi)

getCandidateHosts

public static String[] getCandidateHosts(Document jsdl)
Parses the jsdl document and gets a list of all HostName elements (of which we currently only use the one at index 0). This is not really used in the proper way because Grisu allows the queue to be included in the value as well (sque@brecca:ng2.vpac.org).

Parameters:
jsdl - the jsdl docuemnt the jsdl Document
Returns:
a list of hostnames

getDescription

public static String getDescription(Document jsdl)
Parses the jsdl document and returns the value of the Description element.

Parameters:
jsdl - the jsdl document
Returns:
the description of the type of job

                                                                   String fileSystemName)
Returns a list of all elements that use the filesystem with the specified alias.

Parameters:
jsdl - the jsdl document
fileSystemName - the name of the filesystem
Returns:
a list of all elements

getJsdl

public static String getJsdl(Document jsdl)
                      throws TransformerException
Converts the jsdl xml document into string format.

Parameters:
jsdl - the jsdl document as a Document
Returns:
the jsdl document as String
Throws:
TransformerFactoryConfigurationError - if the TransformerFactory can't be created
TransformerException - if the Transformer throws an error while transforming the xml document

getModules

public static String[] getModules(Document jsdl)
This one does not really follow the jsdl syntax. But we use something called "modules" within the APACGrid so here it is. I suppose I should write my own extension to the jsdl standard, somthing like jsdl-apac. Problem is, I don't know how... Anyway. This parses a jsdl template document and extracts all jsdl-posix:Module elements.

Parameters:
jsdl - the jsdl document
Returns:
all modules that have to be loaded for running this job

getMountSourceElement

                                            String fileSystemName)
Returns the element that is connected to this filesystem alias.

Parameters:
jsdl - the jsdl document
fileSystemName - the name of the filesystem
Returns:
the MountSourceElement

getPbsDebugElement

public static String getPbsDebugElement(Document jsdl)
Returns whether pbs-debugging should be enabled for this job or not. This is an ARCS-specific extension to jsdl/rsl.

Parameters:
jsdl - the jsdl file
Returns:
whether to enable pbs-debugging or not

Parameters:
jsdl - the jsdl document
Returns:
a list of all arguments

getPosixApplicationExecutable

public static String getPosixApplicationExecutable(Document jsdl)
Parses the jsdl document and returns the value of the jsdl-posix:Executable element. This is the name (and path) of the executable.

Parameters:
jsdl - the jsdl document
Returns:
the (path to the) application

Returns:
the path to the stderr file (relative to the working directory)

getTemplateTagInfoElement

public static Element getTemplateTagInfoElement(Document jsdl,
                                                String templateTagName)
Gets the (ARCS-specific) templateTag info element which is used to display information about the application/executable that is used for this job.

Parameters:
jsdl - the jsdl document
templateTagName - the name of the template tag
Returns:
the element

getTemplateTagInfoItems

public static Map<String,String> getTemplateTagInfoItems(Document jsdl,
                                                         String templateTagName)
Returns a map of all infoitems for this template or null, if no infoItem exists.

Parameters:
jsdl - the jsdl
templateTagName - the name of the template tag
Returns:
the map or null

getTotalMemoryRequirement

public static long getTotalMemoryRequirement(Document jsdl)
Returns the total memory requirement for this job. This is the memory that is required for each cpu multiplied with the number of cpus.

Parameters:
jsdl - the jsdl document
Returns:
the total memory requirment

getUserExecutionHostFs

public static String getUserExecutionHostFs(Document jsdl)
Parses the jsdl document and returns the url of filesystem on which the files are staged in using the EXECUTION_HOST_FILESYSTEM variable to determine what the name is for that ("executionHostFs").

Parameters:
jsdl - the jsdl document
Returns:
the url of filesystem where all the files are staged in

getUserExecutionHostFSElement

public static Element getUserExecutionHostFSElement(Document jsdl)

getWalltime

public static int getWalltime(Document jsdl)
Returns the content of the walltime element in the jsdl file. The walltime specified in the jsdl document should be "walltime in seconds * no cpus". This is not what this method gives back. This is not what this method gives back. The walltime this method gives back is the total walltime in seconds.

Parameters:
jsdl - the jsdl document
Returns:
the walltime in seconds or -1 if there is no (or no valid) entry

getWorkingDirectory

public static String getWorkingDirectory(Document jsdl)
Parses the jsdl document and returns the value of the jsdl-posix:WorkingDirectory element. That information is of not much use unless you know as well to which filesyste it's relative.

Parameters:
jsdl - the jsdl document
Returns:
the working directory (relative to $GLOBUS_HOME in our case)

setApplicationName

public static void setApplicationName(Document xmlTemplateDoc,
                                      String application)
Sets the name of the application to use for this job.

Parameters:
xmlTemplateDoc - the jsdl document
application - the name of the application

setApplicationVersion

public static void setApplicationVersion(Document jsdl,
                                         String version)
Parses the jsdl document and returns the value of the ApplicationVersion element.

Parameters:
jsdl - the jsdl document
version - the version of the application

setCandidateHosts

public static void setCandidateHosts(Document jsdl,
                                     String[] subLocs)
Sets the submission location of the job.

Parameters:
jsdl - the jsdl document
subLocs - the submission locations
Throws:
XPathExpressionException - if the candidatehosts element could not be found

setJobname

public static void setJobname(Document jsdl,
                              String new_jobname)
                       throws XPathExpressionException
Sets the name of the job (by changing the value of the jsdl:JobName element). If there is already a name specified it will be overwritten.

Parameters:
jsdl - the jsdl document
new_jobname - the new name of the job.
Throws:
XPathExpressionException - if the JobName element could not be found

setProcessorCount

public static void setProcessorCount(Document jsdl,
                                     int processorcount)
Sets the totalCPUcount of the job. If there is already a cpucount specified it will be overwritten.

Parameters:
jsdl - the jsdl document
processorcount - the new totalcputime
Throws:
XPathExpressionException - if the JobName element could not be found

setSourceForStageInElement

public static void setSourceForStageInElement(Element stageIn,
                                              String source_url)
Sets the name of the source file that gets staged into the job directory.

Parameters:
stageIn - the DataStaging element
source_url - the url of the source file

setTotalCPUTimeInSeconds

public static void setTotalCPUTimeInSeconds(Document jsdl,
                                            int totalcputimeinseconds)
Sets the totalCPUTime of the job in seconds. If there is already a walltime specified it will be overwritten. Be aware that you need to multiply the walltime in seconds times the number of cpus for this job to get the proper totalcputime.

Parameters:
jsdl - the jsdl document
totalcputimeinseconds - the new totalcputime
Throws:
XPathExpressionException - if the JobName element could not be found

setWorkingDirectory

public static void setWorkingDirectory(Document jsdl,
                                       String fileSystemName,
                                       String path)
Sets the falue of the workingdirectory element.

Parameters:
jsdl - the jsdl document
fileSystemName - the name of the filesystem where the workingdirectory sits
path - the path to the workingdirectory

validateJSDL

public static boolean validateJSDL(Document jobDescription)
Checks whether the jsdl jobDescription against jsdl.xsd to see whether it's valid xml.

Parameters:
jobDescription - the jsdl xml document
Returns:
true if valid - false if not
